recipe.name: Persian Eggplant (Naz Khatoon)
recipe.instructions:
1. Roast the eggplants in the oven, taking care not to over-roast them (DO THIS EARLIER THE SAME DAY TO ALLOW THEM TO COOL. If they are refrigerated, their consistency will change.). 2. Sauté the onions in the olive oil. 3. After the eggplants cool, peel away the skin and chop them. 4. Once the onions are a golden color, stir in the garlic. 5. Stir the onions and garlic for 2 to 3 minutes. 6. Add the eggplants to the onions and garlic. 7. Stir the mixture for another 2 to 3 minutes. 8. Chop the cilantro. 9. Add the tomatoes to the mixture and stir. 10. Add the salt, pepper, turmeric, dry mint and angelica. 11. Stir the spices into the mixture thoroughly. 12. Stir the chopped cilantro into the mixture. 13. Stir in the sour grape juice and pomegranate molasses. 14. Cover the pan and simmer for 30 minutes on medium low heat. 15. Serve as a side dish with rice.
24. Drizzle half the leftover saffron butter on the chicken pieces, then put the lid back on the pan 25. Fish barberry fruit from the top of the water into a colander, checking carefully for thorns or small stones 26. Wash the barberry in the colander, still checking for impurities 27. Put two tablespoons of sugar into a small pan 28. Add some boiling water to dissolve the sugar 29. Swish the pan around to dissolve the sugar 30. Add the barberry and let it simmer for a couple of minutes (uncovered) 31. Add the rest of the saffron butter to the barberry, then stir to mix it in 32. Plate rice (she spread across the whole plate) 33. Plate barberry as a small stripe across the middle of the plate 34. Plate pistachios on one side of the barberry and chicken on the other 35. Spread some of the cooking juices from the chicken on top of the chicken
